Document.Title: T-SQL: Stored Procedure Structure for Microsoft SQL Server 7.0

Content:
USE DatabaseName
GO

IF OBJECT_ID('StoredProcName') IS NOT NULL
BEGIN
    DROP PROCEDURE StoredProcName
    IF OBJECT_ID('StoredProcName') IS NOT NULL
        PRINT '<<< FAILED DROPPING PROCEDURE StoredProcName >>>'
    ELSE
        PRINT '<<< DROPPED PROCEDURE StoredProcName >>>'
END
GO

CREATE PROCEDURE StoredProcName
    (
        @param int = 0
    )
AS

-- Description: Stored proc' structure for SQL Server 7.0.
-- Developer: rasx

SET NOCOUNT ON

-- This proc' takes advantage of the new security features in SQL Server 7.0.

RETURN
GO

GRANT EXECUTE ON StoredProcName TO [Windows NT Group]
GO

IF OBJECT_ID('StoredProcName') IS NOT NULL
    PRINT '<<< CREATED PROCEDURE StoredProcName >>>'
ELSE
    PRINT '<<< FAILED CREATING PROCEDURE StoredProcName >>>'
GO
